title: Variables
summary: Variables store values so you can reuse them later. Think of them as labeled boxes that hold information your program needs.
sample_question: What is a variable and why is it useful?

mcq.question: What best describes a variable?
options: A label used to store data.

options: They store data that can be reused.
They are used only for loops.

title: Loops
summary: Loops let you repeat an action multiple times until a condition is met. Common types include for loops and while loops.
sample_question: Explain the difference between a for loop and a while loop.

title: Functions
summary: Functions are reusable blocks of code that perform a specific task. They help organize programs, avoid repetition, and make code more readable. A function is executed when it is called.
sample_question: What is the advantage of using functions?

mcq.question: What is a function?
Why are functions useful?
options: They make code harder to read.
They allow code reuse and better organization.

mcq.question: What is it called when a function is executed?
Which of these defines a function in Python?
What does a return statement do?
options: Sends a value back from the function.

title: Conditions
summary: Conditions help your program decide what to do based on whether something is true or false. They typically use if, elif, and else to choose between different paths.
sample_question: Explain how conditions help programs make decisions.

mcq.question: What is the purpose of an if statement?
options: To check a condition and make decisions.

mcq.question: Which operator is used for equality comparison?

Runs when none of the conditions are true.
